cards.name: Seal of Cleansing
cards.text: Sacrifice Seal of Cleansing: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
cards.flavor:
"I am the purifier, the light that clears all shadows."
—Seal inscription

rulings.text: This is not modal. If the target changes from an artifact to an enchantment or vice versa, this still destroys it.

cards.originalText: Sacrifice Seal of Cleansing: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.

cards.name: Silkenfist Fighter
cards.text: Whenever Silkenfist Fighter becomes blocked, untap it.
cards.flavor:
Simple wooden staff
Made from life, protecting life,
Stronger than cold steel.
cards.originalText: Whenever Silkenfist Fighter becomes blocked, untap it.

cards.name: Silkenfist Order
cards.text: Whenever Silkenfist Order becomes blocked, untap it.
cards.originalText: Whenever Silkenfist Order becomes blocked, untap it.

cards.name: Sivvi's Ruse
cards.text:
If an opponent controls a Mountain and you control a Plains, you may cast this spell without paying its mana cost.
Prevent all damage that would be dealt this turn to creatures you control.
cards.originalText:
If an opponent controls a mountain and you control a plains, you may play Sivvi's Ruse without paying its mana cost.
Prevent all damage that would be dealt this turn to creatures you control.

cards.name: Sivvi's Valor
cards.text:
If you control a Plains, you may tap an untapped creature you control rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
All damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn is dealt to you instead.
cards.originalText:
If you control a plains, you may tap an untapped creature you control instead of paying the mana cost of Sivvi's Valor.
All damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn is dealt to you instead.

cards.name: Spiritual Asylum
cards.text:
Creatures and lands you control have shroud. (They can't be the targets of spells or abilities.)
When a creature you control attacks, sacrifice Spiritual Asylum.
cards.flavor: Trapped in safety is still trapped.
cards.originalText:
Creatures and lands you control can't be the target of spells or abilities.  
When a creature you control attacks, sacrifice Spiritual Asylum.

cards.name: Topple
cards.text: Exile target creature with the greatest power among creatures on the battlefield. (If two or more creatures are tied for greatest power, target any one of them.)
cards.flavor:
"Let all witness the fate of those who defy me."
—Crovax

rulings.text: It can only target a creature with the greatest power. This means you pick such a creature on announcement, and if that creature is not still the one with greatest power on resolution, then this spell doesn't resolve since its target is illegal.

cards.originalText: Remove target creature with the greatest power from the game. (If two or more creatures are tied for greatest power, target only one of them.)

cards.name: Voice of Truth
cards.text: Flying, protection from white
cards.flavor:
"Above them all is Truth, and Truth must be set free. If the wings of Truth are clipped, the voices will fall silent."
—Song of All, canto 167
cards.originalText: Flying, protection from white

cards.name: Accumulated Knowledge
cards.text: Draw a card, then draw cards equal to the number of cards named Accumulated Knowledge in all graveyards.
cards.flavor:
"I have seen and heard much here. There are secrets within secrets. Let me show you."
—Takara, to Eladamri

rulings.text: Because Accumulated Knowledge is still on the stack as you perform its instructions, it isn't in your graveyard and won't add to the number of cards drawn.

cards.originalText: Draw a card, then draw cards equal to the number of Accumulated Knowledge cards in all graveyards.

cards.name: Aether Barrier
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a creature spell, that player sacrifices a permanent unless they pay {1}.
cards.flavor:
"Creatures fade in and out of existence. It's an unfortunate side effect. The losses are tolerable."
—Belbe
cards.originalText: Whenever a player plays a creature spell, that player sacrifices a permanent unless he or she pays {1}.

cards.name: Air Bladder
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has flying.
Enchanted creature can block only creatures with flying.
cards.flavor: Random mutations among Rootwater merfolk were common—and disturbing.
cards.originalText:
Enchanted creature has flying.
Enchanted creature can block only creatures with flying.

cards.name: Cloudskate
cards.text:
Flying
Fading 3 (This creature enters the battlefield with three fade counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a fade counter from it. If you can't, sacrifice it.)
cards.originalText:
Flying 
Fading 3 (This creature comes into play with three fade counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a fade counter from it. If you can't, sacrifice it.)

cards.name: Daze
cards.text:
You may return an Island you control to its owner's hand rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1}.

rulings.text: If another effect causes Daze to cost more, you must pay that additional cost even if you pay its alternative cost.

cards.originalText:
You may return an island you control to its owner's hand instead of paying Daze's mana cost.
Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1}.

cards.name: Dominate
cards.text: Gain control of target creature with converted mana cost X or less.
cards.flavor:
"I've come to reclaim what is mine. And you, Greven, are mine."
—Volrath
cards.originalText: Gain control of target creature with converted mana cost X or less. (This spell's effect doesn't end at end of turn.)

cards.name: Ensnare
cards.text:
You may return two Islands you control to their owner's hand rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
Tap all creatures.
cards.flavor: Rootwater has become as dangerous to its denizens as to its enemies.
cards.originalText:
You may return two islands you control to their owner's hand instead of paying Ensnare's mana cost.
Tap all creatures.

cards.name: Infiltrate
cards.text: Target creature can't be blocked this turn.
cards.flavor: Getting in was the easy part. Getting out proved to be more difficult.
cards.originalText: Target creature is unblockable this turn.

cards.name: Jolting Merfolk
cards.text:
Fading 4 (This creature enters the battlefield with four fade counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a fade counter from it. If you can't, sacrifice it.)
Remove a fade counter from Jolting Merfolk: Tap target creature.
cards.originalText:
Fading 4 (This creature comes into play with four fade counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a fade counter from it. If you can't, sacrifice it.)
Remove a fade counter from Jolting Merfolk: Tap target creature.

cards.name: Oraxid
cards.text: Protection from red
cards.flavor:
"I'm constantly amazed by the tenacity of living creatures on this plane. Even in the stronghold's white-hot core, life persists."
—Ertai
cards.originalText: Protection from red

cards.name: Pale Moon
cards.text: Until end of turn, if a player taps a nonbasic land for mana, it produces colorless mana instead of any other type.
cards.flavor: Denizens of Rath had never seen the moon before. It was a symbol of change, not constancy.

rulings.text: The ability does not change the amount of mana produced, only the color.

cards.originalText: Until end of turn, if a player taps a nonbasic land for mana, it produces colorless mana instead of its normal type.

cards.name: Parallax Tide
cards.text:
Fading 5 (This enchantment enters the battlefield with five fade counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a fade counter from it. If you can't, sacrifice it.)
Remove a fade counter from Parallax Tide: Exile target land.
When Parallax Tide leaves the battlefield, each player returns to the battlefield all cards they own exiled with Parallax Tide.
cards.originalText:
Fading 5
Remove a fade counter from Parallax Tide: Remove target land from the game.
When Parallax Tide leaves play, each player returns to play all cards he or she owns removed from the game with Parallax Tide.

cards.name: Rising Waters
cards.text:
Lands don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player untaps a land they control.
cards.flavor: Rising waters, sinking hope.
cards.originalText:
Lands don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player untaps a land he or she controls.

cards.name: Rootwater Commando
cards.text: Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
cards.flavor: Rootwater merfolk are seldom seen these days, but elf corpses are as numerous as ever.
cards.originalText: Islandwalk (This creature is unblockable as long as defending player controls an island.)

cards.name: Rootwater Thief
cards.text:
{U}: Rootwater Thief gains flying until end of turn.
Whenever Rootwater Thief deals combat damage to a player, you may pay {2}. If you do, search that player's library for a card and exile it, then the player shuffles their library.
cards.originalText:
{U}: Rootwater Thief gains flying until end of turn.
Whenever Rootwater Thief deals combat damage to a player, you may pay {2}. If you do, search that player's library for a card and remove that card from the game, then the player shuffles his or her library.

cards.name: Seahunter
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Search your library for a Merfolk permanent card and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: "They can't feel pain. They just wiggle 'cause they're scared."

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

cards.originalText: {3}, {T}: Search your library for a Merfolk card and put that card into play. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Seal of Removal
cards.text: Sacrifice Seal of Removal: Return target creature to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor:
"I am the unraveler, the loosened thread that will not hold."
—Seal inscription
cards.originalText: Sacrifice Seal of Removal: Return target creature to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Sliptide Serpent
cards.text: {3}{U}: Return Sliptide Serpent to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: It's futile to fight something you can see only in the corner of your eye.
cards.originalText: {3}{U}: Return Sliptide Serpent to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Sneaky Homunculus
cards.text: Sneaky Homunculus can't block or be blocked by creatures with power 2 or greater.
cards.flavor: Keep watch only for the giants and you'll be eaten by the ants.
cards.originalText: Sneaky Homunculus can't block or be blocked by creatures with power 2 or greater.

cards.name: Stronghold Biologist
cards.text: {U}{U}, {T}, Discard a card: Counter target creature spell.
cards.flavor: He twists the laws of nature until they scream.
cards.originalText: {U}{U}, {T}, Discard a card from your hand: Counter target creature spell.

cards.name: Stronghold Machinist
cards.text: {U}{U}, {T}, Discard a card: Counter target noncreature spell.
cards.flavor: She stretches the laws of physics until they snap.
cards.originalText: {U}{U}, {T}, Discard a card from your hand: Counter target noncreature spell.

cards.name: Stronghold Zeppelin
cards.text:
Flying
Stronghold Zeppelin can block only creatures with flying.
cards.flavor: As long as the stronghold controlled the sky, the rebels were doomed.
cards.originalText:
Flying
Stronghold Zeppelin can block only creatures with flying.

cards.name: Submerge
cards.text:
If an opponent controls a Forest and you control an Island, you may cast this spell without paying its mana cost.
Put target creature on top of its owner's library.
cards.originalText:
If an opponent controls a forest and you control an island, you may play Submerge without paying its mana cost. 
Put target creature on top of its owner's library.

cards.name: Trickster Mage
cards.text: {U}, {T}, Discard a card: You may tap or untap target artifact, creature, or land.
cards.flavor: "If it ain't broke, I'll break it. If it is broke, I'll fix it."
cards.originalText: {U}, {T}, Discard a card from your hand: Tap or untap target artifact, creature, or land.

cards.name: Wandering Eye
cards.text:
Flying
Players play with their hands revealed.
cards.flavor: The evincar has many ways of keeping track of his subjects.
cards.originalText:
Flying 
All players play with their hands revealed.

cards.name: Ascendant Evincar
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Other black creatures get +1/+1.
Nonblack creatures get -1/-1.
cards.flavor:
"Things are going to change around here."
—Crovax

rulings.text: If Ascendant Evincar stops being black, it gives itself -1/-1.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Other black creatures get +1/+1.
Nonblack creatures get -1/-1.

cards.name: Battlefield Percher
cards.text:
Flying
Battlefield Percher can block only creatures with flying.
{1}{B}: Battlefield Percher gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.originalText:
Flying 
Battlefield Percher can block only creatures with flying. 
{1}{B}: Battlefield Percher gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Belbe's Percher
cards.text:
Flying
Belbe's Percher can block only creatures with flying.
cards.flavor: Long and powerful, these birds were used to carry messages to and from the evincar.
cards.originalText:
Flying 
Belbe's Percher can block only creatures with flying.

cards.name: Carrion Wall
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{1}{B}: Regenerate Carrion Wall.
cards.flavor: A wall built from the bodies of the enemy will never lack building material in times of war.
cards.originalText:
(Walls can't attack.)
{1}{B}: Regenerate Carrion Wall.

cards.name: Dark Triumph
cards.text:
If you control a Swamp, you may sacrifice a creature rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
Creatures you control get +2/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: All that's left is the coronation.
cards.originalText:
If you control a swamp, you may sacrifice a creature instead of paying Dark Triumph's mana cost. 
Creatures you control get +2/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Death Pit Offering
cards.text:
When Death Pit Offering enters the battlefield, sacrifice all creatures you control.
Creatures you control get +2/+2.
cards.flavor:
"Kill them all and feed them to the new recruits."
—Crovax
cards.originalText:
As Death Pit Offering comes into play, sacrifice all creatures you control.
Creatures you control get +2/+2.

cards.name: Divining Witch
cards.text: {1}{B}, {T}, Discard a card: Choose a card name. Exile the top six cards of your library, then reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal a card with the chosen name. Put that card into your hand and exile all other cards revealed this way.

rulings.text: You name a card during resolution of the ability.

cards.originalText: {1}{B}, {T}, Discard a card from your hand: Name a card. Remove the top six cards of your library from the game. Reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal the named card, then put that card into your hand. Remove all other cards revealed this way from the game.

cards.name: Massacre
cards.text:
If an opponent controls a Plains and you control a Swamp, you may cast this spell without paying its mana cost.
All creatures get -2/-2 until end of turn.
cards.originalText:
If an opponent controls a plains and you control a swamp, you may play Massacre without paying its mana cost.
All creatures get -2/-2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Mind Slash
cards.text: {B}, Sacrifice a creature: Target opponent reveals their hand. You choose a card from it. That player discards that card. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
cards.flavor: "I can't think with all that screaming."
cards.originalText: {B}, Sacrifice a creature: Look at target opponent's hand and choose a card from it. That player discards that card. Play this ability only if you could play a sorcery.

cards.name: Mind Swords
cards.text:
If you control a Swamp, you may sacrifice a creature rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
Each player exiles two cards from their hand.

rulings.text: The active player chooses two cards, then the other player chooses two cards, then all the chosen cards are exiled simultaneously.

cards.originalText:
If you control a swamp, you may sacrifice a creature instead of paying Mind Swords's mana cost.
Each player removes two cards in his or her hand from the game.

cards.name: Murderous Betrayal
cards.text: {B}{B}, Pay half your life, rounded up: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor: In darkness, the assassin sneaked into the village and destroyed what Eladamri loved most: his daughter.
cards.originalText: {B}{B}, Pay half your life rounded up: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Parallax Dementia
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Fading 1 (This enchantment enters the battlefield with one fade counter on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a fade counter from it. If you can't, sacrifice it.)
Enchanted creature gets +3/+2.
When Parallax Dementia leaves the battlefield, destroy enchanted creature. That creature can't be regenerated.
cards.originalText:
Fading 1 (This enchantment comes into play with one fade counter on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a fade counter from it. If you can't, sacrifice it.)
Enchanted creature gets +3/+2.
When Parallax Dementia leaves play, destroy enchanted creature. That creature can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Parallax Nexus
cards.text:
Fading 5 (This enchantment enters the battlefield with five fade counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a fade counter from it. If you can't, sacrifice it.)
Remove a fade counter from Parallax Nexus: Target opponent exiles a card from their hand. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
When Parallax Nexus leaves the battlefield, each player returns to their hand all cards they own exiled with Parallax Nexus.

rulings.text: The target opponent chooses which card to exile.

cards.originalText:
Fading 5
Remove a fade counter from Parallax Nexus: Target opponent removes a card in his or her hand from the game. Play this ability only if you could play a sorcery.
When Parallax Nexus leaves play, each player returns to his or her hand all cards he or she owns removed from the game with Parallax Nexus.

cards.name: Phyrexian Driver
cards.text: When Phyrexian Driver enters the battlefield, other Mercenary creatures get +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Although the abuse was initially effective, the troops soon became numb to it.
cards.originalText: When Phyrexian Driver comes into play, all other Mercenaries get +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Phyrexian Prowler
cards.text:
Fading 3 (This creature enters the battlefield with three fade counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a fade counter from it. If you can't, sacrifice it.)
Remove a fade counter from Phyrexian Prowler: Phyrexian Prowler gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.originalText:
Fading 3 (This creature comes into play with three fade counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a fade counter from it. If you can't, sacrifice it.)
Remove a fade counter from Phyrexian Prowler: Phyrexian Prowler gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Plague Witch
cards.text: {B}, {T}, Discard a card: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "I can ail what cures you."
cards.originalText: {B}, {T}, Discard a card from your hand: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Rathi Assassin
cards.text:
{1}{B}{B}, {T}: Destroy target tapped nonblack creature.
{3}, {T}: Search your library for a Mercenary permanent card with converted mana cost 3 or less and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

cards.originalText:
{1}{B}{B}, {T}: Destroy target tapped nonblack creature.
{3}, {T}: Search your library for a Mercenary card with converted mana cost 3 or less and put that card into play. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Rathi Fiend
cards.text:
When Rathi Fiend enters the battlefield, each player loses 3 life.
{3}, {T}: Search your library for a Mercenary permanent card with converted mana cost 3 or less and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

cards.originalText:
When Rathi Fiend comes into play, each player loses 3 life.
{3}, {T}: Search your library for a Mercenary card with converted mana cost 3 or less and put that card into play. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Rathi Intimidator
cards.text:
Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
{2}, {T}: Search your library for a Mercenary permanent card with converted mana cost 2 or less and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

cards.originalText:
Rathi Intimidator can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and black creatures.
{2}, {T}: Search your library for a Mercenary card with converted mana cost 2 or less and put that card into play. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Seal of Doom
cards.text: Sacrifice Seal of Doom: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor:
"I am the banisher, the ill will that snuffs the final candle."
—Seal inscription
cards.originalText: Sacrifice Seal of Doom: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Spineless Thug
cards.text: Spineless Thug can't block.
cards.flavor: These troops are only as strong as the evincar's control.
cards.originalText: Spineless Thug can't block.

cards.name: Spiteful Bully
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, Spiteful Bully deals 3 damage to target creature you control.
cards.flavor: Like most creatures bent on total destruction, they rarely bother to double-check their targets.

rulings.text: It can damage itself. In fact, it has to if it is the only creature you control.

cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, Spiteful Bully deals 3 damage to target creature you control.

cards.name: Stronghold Discipline
cards.text: Each player loses 1 life for each creature they control.
cards.flavor:
"Crovax never passes up an opportunity to cause widespread misery."
—Belbe
cards.originalText: Each player loses 1 life for each creature he or she controls.

cards.name: Vicious Hunger
cards.text: Vicious Hunger deals 2 damage to target creature and you gain 2 life.
cards.flavor:
"Blood is foul, the flesh dross. My ascendance thirsts for life itself."
—Crovax
cards.originalText: Vicious Hunger deals 2 damage to target creature. You gain 2 life.

cards.name: Volrath the Fallen
cards.text: {1}{B}, Discard a creature card: Volrath the Fallen gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the discarded card's converted mana cost.
cards.flavor: "I stepped out. I did not step down."
cards.originalText: {1}{B}, Discard a creature card from your hand: Volrath the Fallen gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the discarded card's converted mana cost.

cards.name: Ancient Hydra
cards.text:
Fading 5 (This creature enters the battlefield with five fade counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a fade counter from it. If you can't, sacrifice it.)
{1}, Remove a fade counter from Ancient Hydra: Ancient Hydra deals 1 damage to any target.
cards.originalText:
Fading 5 (This creature comes into play with five fade counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a fade counter from it. If you can't, sacrifice it.)
{1}, Remove a fade counter from Ancient Hydra: Ancient Hydra deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Arc Mage
cards.text: {2}{R}, {T}, Discard a card: Arc Mage deals 2 damage divided as you choose among one or two targets.

rulings.text: You can't choose zero targets. You must choose between 1 and 2 targets.

cards.originalText: {2}{R}, {T}, Discard a card from your hand: Arc Mage deals 2 damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures and/or players.

cards.name: Bola Warrior
cards.text: {R}, {T}, Discard a card: Target creature can't block this turn.
cards.flavor: The ingredients for panic include equal parts danger, uncertainty, and helplessness.
cards.originalText: {R}, {T}, Discard a card from your hand: Target creature can't block this turn.

cards.name: Downhill Charge
cards.text:
You may sacrifice a Mountain rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
Target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is the number of Mountains you control.
cards.originalText:
You may sacrifice a mountain instead of paying Downhill Charge's mana cost.
Target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is the number of mountains you control.

cards.name: Flame Rift
cards.text: Flame Rift deals 4 damage to each player.
cards.flavor: Crovax hungered for power, and the stronghold devoured the sky.
cards.originalText: Flame Rift deals 4 damage to each player.

cards.name: Flowstone Crusher
cards.text: {R}: Flowstone Crusher gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Someone must have done something very bad to make a rock that angry."
—Rebel scout

rulings.text: Flowstone Crusher's ability can be activated multiple times, but Flowstone Crusher is put into the graveyard after an effect resolves that makes its toughness 0.

cards.originalText: {R}: Flowstone Crusher gets +1/-1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Flowstone Overseer
cards.text: {R}{R}: Target creature gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The rebels couldn't see where the roar was coming from. Then they saw it was coming from everywhere.
cards.originalText: {R}{R}: Target creature gets +1/-1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Flowstone Slide
cards.text: All creatures get +X/-X until end of turn.
cards.flavor: It may look like soil, but its nature is malice.
cards.originalText: All creatures get +X/-X until end of turn.

cards.name: Flowstone Strike
cards.text: Target creature gets +1/-1 and gains haste until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Aggression exacts its toll.
cards.originalText: Target creature gets +1/-1 and gains haste until end of turn. (It may attack and {T} the turn it comes under your control.)

cards.name: Flowstone Surge
cards.text: Creatures you control get +1/-1.
cards.flavor: The army was never at a loss for weapons; Crovax was their forge.
cards.originalText: Creatures you control get +1/-1.

cards.name: Flowstone Wall
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{R}: Flowstone Wall gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The rebels assaulted the wall, never suspecting the wall would assault back.
cards.originalText:
(Walls can't attack.)
{R}: Flowstone Wall gets +1/-1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Laccolith Grunt
cards.text: Whenever Laccolith Grunt becomes blocked, you may have it deal damage equal to its power to target creature. If you do, Laccolith Grunt assigns no combat damage this turn.
cards.flavor: They leave a trail of ash and sorrow.

rulings.text: The ability triggers even if a spell or ability makes it blocked, instead of being blocked by a creature.
It can target any creature on the battlefield, not just one of the ones blocking it.
The ability allows you to deal damage during the declare blockers step of combat, which is well before even first strike creatures deal damage.
The ability is optional. You can decide to allow it to deal combat damage as normal.

cards.originalText: Whenever Laccolith Grunt becomes blocked, you may have it deal damage equal to its power to target creature. If you do, Laccolith Grunt deals no combat damage this turn.

cards.name: Laccolith Rig
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature becomes blocked, you may have it deal damage equal to its power to target creature. If you do, the first creature assigns no combat damage this turn.

rulings.text: If placed on a Laccolith creature, both this card's ability and the Laccolith's ability will trigger and have their effect.
If this is on an opponent's creature, the controller of this card (not the creature's controller) decides whether to use this card's ability or not, and decides what the target will be.
The ability triggers even if a spell or ability makes it blocked, instead of being blocked by a creature.
It can target any creature on the battlefield, not just one of the ones blocking it.
The ability allows you to deal damage during the declare blockers step of combat, which is well before even first strike creatures deal damage.
The ability is optional. You can decide to allow it to deal combat damage as normal.
Moving the enchantment after the ability triggers will not affect which creatures are affected.

cards.originalText: Whenever enchanted creature becomes blocked, you may have it deal damage equal to its power to target creature. If you do, enchanted creature deals no combat damage this turn.

cards.name: Laccolith Titan
cards.text: Whenever Laccolith Titan becomes blocked, you may have it deal damage equal to its power to target creature. If you do, Laccolith Titan assigns no combat damage this turn.
cards.flavor: Proximity guarantees injury or death.

rulings.text: The ability triggers even if a spell or ability makes it blocked, instead of being blocked by a creature.
It can target any creature on the battlefield, not just one of the ones blocking it.
The ability allows you to deal damage during the declare blockers step of combat, which is well before even first strike creatures deal damage.
The ability is optional. You can decide to allow it to deal combat damage as normal.

cards.originalText: Whenever Laccolith Titan becomes blocked, you may have it deal damage equal to its power to target creature. If you do, Laccolith Titan deals no combat damage this turn.

cards.name: Laccolith Warrior
cards.text: Whenever Laccolith Warrior becomes blocked, you may have it deal damage equal to its power to target creature. If you do, Laccolith Warrior assigns no combat damage this turn.
cards.flavor: The screams are brief. The silence lingers.

rulings.text: The ability triggers even if a spell or ability makes it blocked, instead of being blocked by a creature.
It can target any creature on the battlefield, not just one of the ones blocking it.
The ability allows you to deal damage during the declare blockers step of combat, which is well before even first strike creatures deal damage.
The ability is optional. You can decide to allow it to deal combat damage as normal.

cards.originalText: Whenever Laccolith Warrior becomes blocked, you may have it deal damage equal to its power to target creature. If you do, Laccolith Warrior deals no combat damage this turn.

cards.name: Laccolith Whelp
cards.text: Whenever Laccolith Whelp becomes blocked, you may have it deal damage equal to its power to target creature. If you do, Laccolith Whelp assigns no combat damage this turn.
cards.flavor: They don't feed; they stoke.

rulings.text: The ability triggers even if a spell or ability makes it blocked, instead of being blocked by a creature.
It can target any creature on the battlefield, not just one of the ones blocking it.
The ability allows you to deal damage during the declare blockers step of combat, which is well before even first strike creatures deal damage.
The ability is optional. You can decide to allow it to deal combat damage as normal.

cards.originalText: Whenever Laccolith Whelp becomes blocked, you may have it deal damage equal to its power to target creature. If you do, Laccolith Whelp deals no combat damage this turn.

cards.name: Mana Cache
cards.text:
At the beginning of each player's end step, put a charge counter on Mana Cache for each untapped land that player controls.
Remove a charge counter from Mana Cache: Add {C}. Any player may activate this ability but only during their turn before the end step.
cards.originalText:
At the end of each player's turn, put a charge counter on Mana Cache for each untapped land that player controls.
Remove a charge counter from Mana Cache: Add one colorless mana to your mana pool. Any player may play this ability but only during his or her turn before the end phase.

cards.name: Mogg Alarm
cards.text:
You may sacrifice two Mountains rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
Create two 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens.
cards.flavor: They make mountains into mogg holes.
cards.originalText:
You may sacrifice two mountains instead of paying Mogg Alarm's mana cost. 
Put two 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens into play.

cards.name: Mogg Salvage
cards.text:
If an opponent controls an Island and you control a Mountain, you may cast this spell without paying its mana cost.
Destroy target artifact.
cards.flavor: Three moggs, one treasure, too bad.
cards.originalText:
If an opponent controls an island and you control a mountain, you may play Mogg Salvage without paying its mana cost.
Destroy target artifact.

cards.name: Mogg Toady
cards.text:
Mogg Toady can't attack unless you control more creatures than defending player.
Mogg Toady can't block unless you control more creatures than attacking player.
cards.originalText:
Mogg Toady can't attack unless you control more creatures than defending player.
Mogg Toady can't block unless you control more creatures than attacking player.

cards.name: Moggcatcher
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Search your library for a Goblin permanent card and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: "They're not worth much, but they're easy to catch."

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

cards.originalText: {3}, {T}: Search your library for a Goblin card and put that card into play. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Rupture
cards.text: Sacrifice a creature. Rupture deals damage equal to that creature's power to each creature without flying and each player.
cards.flavor: All creatures have an inner fire. Releasing it can be dangerous.
cards.originalText: Sacrifice a creature. Rupture deals damage equal to that creature's power to each creature without flying and each player.

cards.name: Seal of Fire
cards.text: Sacrifice Seal of Fire: It deals 2 damage to any target.
cards.flavor:
"I am the romancer, the passion that consumes the flesh."
—Seal inscription
cards.originalText: Sacrifice Seal of Fire: Seal of Fire deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Shrieking Mogg
cards.text:
Haste
When Shrieking Mogg enters the battlefield, tap all other creatures.
cards.flavor: You have to admire its enthusiasm.
cards.originalText:
Haste (This creature may attack and {T} the turn it comes under your control.)
When Shrieking Mogg comes into play, tap all other creatures.

cards.name: Stronghold Gambit
cards.text: Each player chooses a card in their hand. Then each player reveals their chosen card. The owner of each creature card revealed this way with the lowest converted mana cost puts it onto the battlefield.

rulings.text: Creature cards which are revealed but are not the lowest cost, or any non-creature cards revealed remain in their owners' hands and stop being revealed.
You don't have to choose a creature card, but choosing a non creature does nothing except maybe bluff your opponent.

cards.originalText: Each player chooses a card in his or her hand. Then each player reveals his or her chosen card. The owner of the creature card revealed this way with the lowest converted mana cost puts that card into play. If two or more creature cards are tied for lowest cost, those cards are put into play.

cards.name: Animate Land
cards.text: Until end of turn, target land becomes a 3/3 creature that's still a land.
cards.flavor: Irony is getting walked on by the earth instead of the other way around.

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

cards.originalText: Until end of turn, target land is a 3/3 creature that's still a land.

cards.name: Blastoderm
cards.text:
Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
Fading 3 (This creature enters the battlefield with three fade counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a fade counter from it. If you can't, sacrifice it.)
cards.originalText:
Fading 3 (This creature comes into play with three fade counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a fade counter from it. If you can't, sacrifice it.)
Blastoderm can't be the target of spells or abilities.

cards.name: Coiling Woodworm
cards.text: Coiling Woodworm's power is equal to the number of Forests on the battlefield.
cards.flavor: Only the elves know where the woods end and the woodworm begins.
cards.originalText: Coiling Woodworm's power is equal to the number of forests in play.

cards.name: Fog Patch
cards.text:
Cast this spell only during the declare blockers step.
Attacking creatures become blocked. (This spell works on creatures that can't be blocked.)
cards.flavor: Realizing they weren't getting past the fog, the elves did the only thing they could do: wait.
cards.originalText:
Play Fog Patch only during the declare blockers step.
Attacking creatures become blocked. (This spell works on unblockable creatures.)

cards.name: Harvest Mage
cards.text: {G}, {T}, Discard a card: Until end of turn, if you tap a land for mana, it produces one mana of a color of your choice instead of any other type and amount.
cards.flavor: "Why should one limit oneself to the resources at hand?"
cards.originalText: {G}, {T}, Discard a card from your hand: Until end of turn, if you tap a land for mana, it produces one mana of any color instead of its normal type and amount.

cards.name: Mossdog
cards.text: Whenever Mossdog becomes the target of a spell or ability an opponent controls, put a +1/+1 counter on Mossdog.
cards.flavor: The more you look at it, the more dangerous it becomes.
cards.originalText: Whenever Mossdog becomes the target of a spell or ability an opponent controls, put a +1/+1 counter on Mossdog.

cards.name: Nesting Wurm
cards.text:
Trample
When Nesting Wurm enters the battlefield, you may search your library for up to three cards named Nesting Wurm, reveal them, and put them into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.
cards.originalText:
Trample
When Nesting Wurm comes into play, you may search your library for up to three Nesting Wurm cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.

cards.name: Overlaid Terrain
cards.text:
As Overlaid Terrain enters the battlefield, sacrifice all lands you control.
Lands you control have "{T}: Add two mana of any one color."
cards.flavor: One must reap before one can sow.

rulings.text: You sacrifice your lands right before this card enters the battlefield. There is no way to tap your lands using the 2-mana ability before they are sacrificed.

cards.originalText:
As Overlaid Terrain comes into play, sacrifice all lands you control.
Lands you control have "{T}: Add two mana of any one color to your mana pool."

cards.name: Pack Hunt
cards.text: Search your library for up to three cards with the same name as target creature, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: The one you see is just a diversion.
cards.originalText: Search your library for up to three copies of target creature, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Refreshing Rain
cards.text:
If an opponent controls a Swamp and you control a Forest, you may cast this spell without paying its mana cost.
Target player gains 6 life.
cards.originalText:
If an opponent controls a swamp and you control a forest, you may play Refreshing Rain without paying its mana cost.
Target player gains 6 life.

cards.name: Reverent Silence
cards.text:
If you control a Forest, rather than pay this spell's mana cost, you may have each other player gain 6 life.
Destroy all enchantments.
cards.originalText:
If you control a forest, you may have each other player gain 6 life instead of paying Reverent Silence's mana cost.
Destroy all enchantments.

cards.name: Rhox
cards.text:
You may have Rhox assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.
{2}{G}: Regenerate Rhox. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)

rulings.text: You can decide to assign damage to the defending player or planeswalker even if the blocking creature has protection from green or damage preventing effects on it.

When assigning combat damage, you choose whether you want to assign all damage to blocking creatures, or if you want to assign all of it to the player or planeswalker this creature is attacking. You can't split the damage assignment between them.
If blocked by a creature with banding, the defending player decides whether or not the damage is assigned "as though it weren't blocked".

cards.originalText:
You may have Rhox deal combat damage to defending player as though it weren't blocked.
{2}{G}: Regenerate Rhox.

cards.name: Saproling Burst
cards.text:
Fading 7 (This enchantment enters the battlefield with seven fade counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a fade counter from it. If you can't, sacrifice it.)
Remove a fade counter from Saproling Burst: Create a green Saproling creature token. It has "This creature's power and toughness are each equal to the number of fade counters on Saproling Burst."
When Saproling Burst leaves the battlefield, destroy all tokens created with Saproling Burst. They can't be regenerated.

rulings.text: Each token knows which Saproling Burst it came from.

cards.originalText:
Fading 7
Remove a fade counter from Saproling Burst: Put a green Saproling creature token into play. It has "This creature's power and toughness are each equal to the number of fade counters on Saproling Burst."
When Saproling Burst leaves play, destroy all tokens put into play with Saproling Burst. They can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Saproling Cluster
cards.text: {1}, Discard a card: Create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token. Any player may activate this ability.
cards.originalText: {1}, Discard a card from your hand: Put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token into play. Any player may play this ability.

cards.name: Seal of Strength
cards.text: Sacrifice Seal of Strength: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"I am the feeder, the morsel that revives the starving."
—Seal inscription
cards.originalText: Sacrifice Seal of Strength: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

cards.name: Skyshroud Behemoth
cards.text:
Fading 2 (This creature enters the battlefield with two fade counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a fade counter from it. If you can't, sacrifice it.)
Skyshroud Behemoth enters the battlefield tapped.
cards.originalText:
Fading 2 (This creature comes into play with two fade counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a fade counter from it. If you can't, sacrifice it.)
Skyshroud Behemoth comes into play tapped.

cards.name: Skyshroud Claim
cards.text: Search your library for up to two Forest cards, put them onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: The forest's constant struggle is to keep the spreading flowstone at bay.
cards.originalText: Search your library for up to two forest cards and put them into play. Then shuffle your library.
